intro: Erodium malacoides var. althaeoides, commonly known as the althaeoides variant of the sticky weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its fruits are trifoliate pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and open woodlands. This variant is notable for its ability to spread rapidly and is considered a weed in some regions.
